Ttcs.Description: Identification information for this node

Item.Description: Milliseconds (after the integer second) since processor start-up

Ttcs.Description: Unique serial number of the CubeSpace Component

Item.Description: OTP ASCII string of chars denoting the serial number of this module
Config ASCII string of chars denoting the serial number of this module
Which serial number (OTP/Config) should be used for identification

Ttcs.Description: Configuration of base bootloader

Item.Description: Configurable serial number - used only if OtpOverride==TRUE
The amount of time the bootloader waits before automatically jumping to the default app target. Ensure that this value is large enough to be able to halt the bootloader
If set, the node will always ignore OTP and use the serial number in config (NodeType+SerialInt)

Ttcs.Description: State information of the application

Item.Description: Error code for the last operation - gets reset to 0 at start of new operation
The current address being used for the operation, if applicable
The current bank being used for erase operation, if applicable
The current page being used for erase operation, if applicable
The amount of data remaining for operation, if applicable

Ttcs.Description: Error information of the application

Item.Description: Error code for the last operation - gets reset to 0 at start of new operation
Error code for HAL initialization (0 = OK)
Error code for Flash initialization (0 = OK)
Error code for UART1 initialization (0 = OK)
Error code for UART2 initialization (0 = OK)
Error code for CAN1 initialization (0 = OK)
Error code for CAN2 initialization (0 = OK)
Error code for I2C initialization (0 = OK)
Config error flag set if configuration CRC failed and default config is being used
Timeout error flag on last operation
Data overrun error flag on last operation
Page erase error flag on last operation
Write error flag on last operation
File CRC error flag on upload complete
Set if failure to write file table to flash
Set if failure to write config table to flash
Set if the jump target is invalid

Ttcs.Description: Reset the file info index to start from the first index in the file list. Then request file info to increment the index automatically until last is detected
Get information on the current file entry index. The index will automatically increment every time this telemetry is requested, and wrap back to first entry

Item.Description: Set if the file associated with this entry failed CRC check. Use file handle to delete the entry
The Program Type associated with the file
The adddress in flash where the file is located
Firmware version (Major) that this file is for/from
Firmware version (Minor) that this file is for/from
Firmware version (Patch) that this file is for/from
System version (Major) that this file is for/from
System version (Minor) that this file is for/from
System version (Patch) that this file is for/from
ASCII string of chars denoting the serial number this file is associated with
Signals if the fil list is empty
Signals if this returned entry is the first in the file list - used to manage wrapping
Signals if this returned entry is the last in the file list - used to manage wrapping

Ttcs.Description: Setup a file write

Item.Description: CubeSpace File Meta Data. May be less than allocated size (padding required)

Ttcs.Description: Delete a file entry

Item.Description: File handle of the entry to delete.

Ttcs.Description: Setup a memory write - not to be used under normal circumstances

Item.Description: Should the region to be written be automatically erased

Ttcs.Description: Setup a memory read - not to be used under normal circumstances
Setup a memory erase - not to be used under normal circumstances
Read/Write - not to be used under normal circumstances
Commit option bytes. Will cause reset if successful
Perform a soft reset

Item.Description: The type of reset to perform

Ttcs.Description: Set/Get the default application the bootloader will jump to if not specifically commanded

Item.Description: File handle of the default app to jump to. Must request FileInfo to get the handle. The selected file must be of type bin.

Ttcs.Description: Trigger Bootloader to jump to the default application
Trigger Bootloader to jump to the specified application

Item.Description: File handle of the app to jump to. Must request FileInfo to get the handle. The selected file must be of type bin.

Ttcs.Description: Trigger Bootloader to jump to the specified address - DO NOT use under normal circumstances
Stay in bootloader. Do NOT jump to app
Used with the I2C protocol to receive Telecommand Ack/Nack

Item.Description: Flag indicating if this acknowledgement has been read sinc the last TCTLM

Ttcs.Description: Communication Status

Item.Description: UART1 No. of telemetry requests received

Item.DisplayName: UART1 Errors reported in SW checks
Item.Description: UART1 Errors reported in SW checks

Item.DisplayName: UART1 Errors reported by HW Flags
Item.Description: UART1 Errors reported by HW Flags
UART2 No. of telemetry requests received

Item.DisplayName: UART2 Errors reported in SW checks
Item.Description: UART2 Errors reported in SW checks

Item.DisplayName: UART2 Errors reported by HW Flags
Item.Description: UART2 Errors reported by HW Flags
CAN1 No. of telemetry requests received

Item.DisplayName: CAN1 Errors reported in SW checks
Item.Description: CAN1 Errors reported in SW checks

Item.DisplayName: CAN1 Errors reported by HW Flags
Item.Description: CAN1 Errors reported by HW Flags
CAN2 No. of telemetry requests received

Item.DisplayName: CAN2 Errors reported in SW checks
Item.Description: CAN2 Errors reported in SW checks

Item.DisplayName: CAN2 Errors reported by HW Flags
Item.Description: CAN2 Errors reported by HW Flags
I2C No. of telemetry requests received

Item.DisplayName: I2C Errors reported in SW checks
Item.Description: I2C Errors reported in SW checks

Item.DisplayName: I2C Errors reported by HW Flags
Item.Description: I2C Errors reported by HW Flags

EnumValue.Description: Bootloader is idle and ready to receive commands
Busy setting up read/write transfer - includes firmware file writes
Busy erasing flash - internally triggered when uploading a firmware binary or config file (with metadata), or specified explicitely by user when writing raw data to memory
Busy erasing flash
Busy waiting for next frame
Busy writing flash
Busy committing new file to file table (including CRC calculation) - happens after successful data transfer
Busy erase file table flash region in preperation for re-write - happens after successful file commit - intermediary step to improve comms responsiveness of bare-metal application
Busy writing file table to flash - happens after successful table erase - this is the final step of a file upload, state returns to idle
Busy reading flash
Busy deleting file entry
Busy setting the default application target
Busy jumping to application
Busy reloading config after being set by the user. If the new config is successfully written to flash, a soft reset is triggered to reload the config automatically.
Busy writing option bytes. If successful the MCU will reset automatically, otherwise the result will be stored in errors
Busy launching option bytes. Will reset immediately if successful
Binary image file
Binary config file
Dummy Value
Performs reset immediately - not the same as common-framework
Performs reset immediately
